title: How to Change a Display Language on Windows 7 Without Vistalizator

steps.title: Download a Language Pack for Non-SP1 (Build 7600) or SP1 (Build 7601).
steps.content: Download a Language Pack for Non-SP1 (Build 7600) or SP1 (Build 7601). You can extract the language pack exe. file for lp.cab to avoid disappearing it by copying it or dragging it.

steps.title: Go to start, search CMD and right click it and run it as an administrator.
steps.content: Go to start, search CMD and right click it and run it as an administrator.

steps.title: In the command prompt, type DISM /Online /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:
steps.content: In the command prompt, type DISM /Online /Add-Package /PackagePath:C: \LP-DE \ lp.cab

steps.title: When it is completed, type bcdedit /set {current} locale de-DE.
steps.content: When it is completed, type bcdedit /set {current} locale de-DE.

steps.title: Then type exit or press the red X and click start, regedit, Click Yes.
steps.content: Then type exit or press the red X and click start, regedit, Click Yes.

steps.title: In regedit, go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MUI\UILanguages and delete the en-us.
steps.content: In regedit, go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MUI\UILanguages and delete the en-us.

steps.title: Restart your computer, windows will change the language and have fun!
steps.content: Restart your computer, windows will change the language and have fun!
